intro: Lomaria unguiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lomaria, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Lomaria unguiculata is often used in herbal medicine for its purported diuretic and antispasmodic properties.
